alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Morgan; Owen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 10:58PM EDT until March 27 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river and locations in Indiana... White River from Centerton down to Hazleton. .Widespread rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with numerous smaller tributaries. These smaller tributaries will drop back below flood within the next few days. Water continues to rise in many locations on main stem rivers, however, and crests in some areas, particularly along lower reaches of the White and Wabash, will not arrive for several days. Moderate flooding is expected in a small number of locations. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River near Centerton. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.4 feet, Road just north of Blue Bluff Bridge has about six inches of water on it. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 12.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to flood stage tomorrow morning. It will rise to 12.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
